heading: Old-age dependency ratio across the EU countries
subheading: How dependent is the elderly population of the working age population in the EU27 in 2023
textNote: The old age dependency ratio is the ratio of elderly dependents (who are generally economically inactive, under over 64 years old), compared to the number of people of working age (15-64-year-olds). A high dependency ratio means those of working age, and the overall economy, face a greater burden in supporting the dependent population.
